qas.question: What can Philosophy education be when we talk about the process?

answers.text: philosophy of the process of education or the philosophy of the discipline of education
the philosophical study of education and its problems

qas.question: What fields make up field education and a field applied philosophy?

answers.text: metaphysics, epistemology, axiology and the philosophical approaches

plausible_answers.text: philosophical study of education and its problems

qas.question: What does not define philosophy education?

plausible_answers.text: metaphysics, epistemology, axiology and the philosophical approaches

qas.question: What fields do not make up field education?
What does not draw from fields of metaphysics?
What study does not constitute as upbringing and education?

context: As an academic field, philosophy of education is "<a1_0>the <b3_0>philosophical study of education and its problems<b3_0/><a1_0/> (...) its central subject matter is education, and its methods are those of philosophy". "The philosophy of education may be either the <a0_0>philosophy of the process of education or the philosophy of the discipline of education<a0_0/>. That is, it may be part of the discipline in the sense of being concerned with the aims, forms, methods, or results of the process of educating or being educated; or it may be metadisciplinary in the sense of being concerned with the concepts, aims, and methods of the discipline." As such, it is both part of the field of education and a field of <b5_0>applied philosophy<b5_0/>, drawing from fields of <a2_0><b4_0>metaphysics, epistemology, axiology and the philosophical approaches<b4_0/><a2_0/> (speculative, prescriptive, and/or analytic) to address questions in and about pedagogy, education policy, and curriculum, as well as the process of learning, to name a few. For example, it might study what constitutes upbringing and education, the <b6_0>values and norms<b6_0/> revealed through upbringing and educational practices, the limits and legitimization of education as an academic discipline, and the relation between education theory and practice.
